pros: It a learning organization that is open to great opportunities
cons: Limited responsibilities which will be a challenge to someone with great multi-tasking skills

pros: Flexible work environment 13 months salary Leave allowance
cons: Processes are slow Not competitive salary compare to other ngos

review_title: Life at SOS children villages Nigeria
job_title: National Coordinator in Abuja, Federal Capital Territory
pros: You receive pay rise every year "if qualified". HMO package is huge. 100% ,13th month bonus is regular following your anniversary. Paid leave bonus up to 70% of monthly salary. Dependant education support.
cons: Cons becomes obvious and observable within first month of work especially if working close to the top management.
It is quite tedious and streesful.

review_title: The job is fulfilling but the environment isn't
pros:
High prospects of Individual development opportunities

Noble career ground, good work/life balance
cons:
Too many bureaucratic processes, The claim to keep family together does not reflect on staff reality. 
Low salaries.
Favouritism in growth prospect, sycophancy and presence among staff

pros:
Bad work culture.
Favoritism
Cheating 
backstabbing

review_title: A CIVIL SERVICE COMMISSION TYPE OF PLACE. Befriend the Director and you get promoted.
job_title: National Coordinator in Abuja, Federal Capital Territory
pros:
Good people
Maternity benefit
vacation
easy work environment
work with older persons
cons:
If you are looking for a fast-paced and challenging environment - SOS is the wrong place for that. Many employees have been there for a long time and continue to do things, the old way.
Innovations are not readily accepted and any challenge with your team lead is easily overlooked.
the organization head places spies across the work environment and workers cant really trust each other.
Promotions are easy for you, only if you are liked or you join the clique.
As with other places, Internal Politics and bureaucracy
No Induction or training for new staff

pros: Good learning opportunities if you are keen
